Package gui

Class HDController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gui.HDController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class HDController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    The HDController class initializes variables for a chat client, request time, users, and arrays for information selection and general grades.

      • SetHeadOfDepartment

        public void SetHeadOfDepartment​(logic.Users Hod,
                                ChatClient client)
        This function sets the head of department and chat client for a given user.
        Parameters:
        Hod - This parameter is of type "Users" and represents the Head of Department that we want to set for a particular object instance.
        client - The "client" parameter is an object of the "ChatClient" class, which is likely used to establish a connection between the user and the chat system. It could contain information such as the user's login credentials, chat history, and other settings related to the chat client.

      • setTest

        public void setTest​(java.lang.String test)
        This is a setter method in Java that sets the value of a variable named "test".
        Parameters:
        test - The parameter "test" is a String variable that is being set to the value passed as an argument to the method. The "this" keyword is used to refer to the instance variable "test" of the current object. This method is a setter method that sets the value of the "test"

      • setGeneralArray

        public void setGeneralArray​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> generalGradesArray)
        This function sets the value of a class variable "generalGradesArray" to an ArrayList of Strings passed as a parameter.
        Parameters:
        generalGradesArray - An ArrayList of Strings that represents the general grades array that needs to be set for an object. This method sets the value of the generalGradesArray instance variable of the object to the value passed as a parameter.

      • showtenths

        public void showtenths​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
        Display the information in a histogram according to division into tenths checks for input rror(empty fields)
        Parameters:
        ActionEvent - event send to server the request for the grades of the required info' and then this will activate another function that will divide the grades into tenths using import__NAME__statisticstenths method the function wll call correct function according to the fxid of the button that calls it

        public void ShowGradeStatistics​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                java.io.IOException
        The function is called by the "show statistics" button on each screen. The function brings information about grades according to the screen from which it was called
        Parameters:
        ActionEvent - event
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.io.IOException
